linkId: H1/T1

text: Over the last two weeks, how often have you been bothered by any of the following problems?

type: GROUP

Items

-ExtensionExtensionExtensionLinkIdCodeTextTypeAnswerValueSet
* H1/T1/Q1 Little interest or pleasure in doing things?CHOICE#VSPHQ9
* H1/T1/Q2 Feeling down, depressed, or hopeless?CHOICE#VSPHQ9

* H1/T1/Q4 Feeling tired or having little energy?CHOICE#VSPHQ9
* H1/T1/Q5 Poor appetite or overeating?CHOICE#VSPHQ9
* H1/T1/Q6 Feeling bad about yourself - or that you are a failure or have let yourself or your family down?CHOICE#VSPHQ9
* H1/T1/Q7 Trouble concentrating on things, such as reading the newspaper or watching television?CHOICE#VSPHQ9

contained.description: The answer list for questions addressing the frequency in which patient reports experiencing behaviors that are assessed in the PHQ-9 Questionnaire.

name: SDC - PHQ-9
title: Patient Health Questionnaire - 9 Item
publisher: HL7 International - FHIR Infrastructure Work Group
description: This is a Questionnaire example of how the PHQ-9 Questionnaire could be rendered as a FHIR Questionnaire Resource according to the Structured Data Capture SDC Questionnaire Profile. This example also portrays how FHIRpaths can be used to perform total score calculations using answer values.
purpose: This Questionnaire example was generated to ensure a non-proprietary, publicly available questionnaire that is available to test the Structured Data Capture profiles
copyright: This content is an unaltered digital reproduction of the PHQ-9 which is copyrighted by Pfizer Inc., which states that no permission is required to reproduce, translate, display or distribute the PHQ-9.

item.text: Over the last two weeks, how often have you been bothered by any of the following problems?
Little interest or pleasure in doing things?
Trouble falling or staying asleep, or sleeping too much?
Feeling tired or having little energy?
Feeling bad about yourself - or that you are a failure or have let yourself or your family down?
Trouble concentrating on things, such as reading the newspaper or watching television?
Moving or speaking so slowly that other people could gave noticed? Or so fidgety or restless that you have been moving a lot more than usual?
Thoughts that you would be better off dead, or thoughts of hurting yourself in some way?

valueExpression.description: Score (0-4: None-minimal; 5-9: Mild; 19-14: Moderate; 15-19: Moderately severe; 20-27: Severe)
valueExpression.name: score

code.display: Patient Health Questionnaire 9 item (PHQ-9) total score [Reported]
